text: We hear a train’s mournful clatter as trees flash by and the train itself passes in a silvery streak. A woman draws an “x” on her foggy window-- looking out through it directly at us: This is RACHEL and she is THE GIRL ON THE TRAIN.

..-My husband used to tell me I have an overactive imagination. I can’t help it. I mean, haven’t you ever been on a train and wondered about the lives of the people who live near the tracks? The lives you've never lived. RACHEL’S POV: Out the window: A series of backyards slowl passes: A MAN walks towards his front yard. An OLDER MAN works on a vintage car in his yard. CHILDREN slide down playground equipment. A LONE BOY throws a ball. His dog chases after it.
These are things I want to know. Rachel sits alone, sketching in a small notebook. CLOSE ON: Rachel’s expectant eyes as the train begins to slow.

«+. Twice a day I sit in the third car from the front where I have the perfect view into my favorite house: Number 15 Beckett Road... RACHEL’S POV: Standing on the upstairs deck of a house, a gorgeous blonde, MEGAN, wears a light opened robe with on white underwear and bra underneath. She stretches her bac like a cat. Her curved silhouette is intoxicating. The train comes to a brief stop at the station and, outsi the other window, Rachel can see work crews fixing the tracks. And beyond them, the Hudson River. (CONTINUED)

...I don’t know when exactly. I suppose I started noticing her about a year ago and, gradually, as the months went past, she became important to me... As the train creeps forward RACHEL SPOTS-- A BLUE HOUSE WITH A WHITE PICKET FENCE... .--She quickly averts her eyes from the view of the house repressing an inner pain. Focusing on her sketch book. Rachel's eyes land on a MAN IN A SUIT, red hair, 50, past and plain-- typing on a laptop. He looks up at Rachel. Th is something disconcerting about the exchange.
I’m not the girl I used to be. I think people can see it on my face.

Rachel's profile has flipped: she now rides in the opposi direction, on the EVENING TRAIN. She watches the familiar houses glide past. RACHEL’S POV: This evening, Megan sits with her equally beautiful husband, SCOTT next to a backyard fire pit. Each holds a glass of wine. The roaring fire glows on the faces as they watch the passing train. SCOTT spins Megan around and begins to kiss her.
She's what I lost. She’s everything I want to be... Rachel returns to her sketchbook.

Headed back to New York, Rachel POV: Rachel stares at the burnt out fire pit behind 15 Beckett Road. Megan is on the balcony in her robe while Scott rakes lea CLOSE ON: Scott as he looks up from raking and seems to l directly at Rachel.
Rachel's train arrives and she wades through a sea of commuters in the Grand Hall. She wears a plain dress and carries a work satchel.
...now departing track nineteen, upper level.
Rachel sits in a row of chairs getting her shoes shined. She’s the only woman among eight male customers. Rachel sketches in her sketch book and sips from a squirt bottle.
...I imagine she’s a painter... She's creative. CLOSE ON SKETCH PAD: We see Rachel’s hand at work as she produces a beautiful images of Megan and Scott.
He’s a doctor or an architect.
Rachel sits at the counter continuing to draw in her sket book. The restaurant is bustling with tourists and locals
He has a good laugh. She can’t cook.
(to customer) Do you need anything else right now?
No. I think we’re pretty good, thanks. Rachel is lost in her imagination. All sounds of the bust bar fade away. Rachel eats an olive from her martini.
I wonder what they say to each other before they go to sleep.
The cityscape slowly spins below us as we find the train the tracks.
Rachel's profile has flipped again: she rides the EVENING TRAIN and watches as she passes the urban landscape of Harlem.

Today her name is “Jess,” tomorrow it could be “Lisa” or “Amber.” It all depends on the day, it depends on my mood. Later that night, as the train slows, Rachel nears the bl house (23 Beckett Road). She looks to her lap, letting it pass. She raises her head and looks at Number 15 Beckett Road. ..-NOW, Megan and Scott can be seen kissing through the window of their house.
The truth is, I don’t know her name. I don’t know if she paints or whether he has a good laugh. I just know they know love... RACHEL'S POV: Megan and Scott begin to make love.

Sometimes I catch myself trying to remember the last time I had meaningful contact with another person... Rachel stays on the couple then an irresistible urge pull her gaze back to the blue house two doors down. This time, when the Blue House (23 Beckett Road) appears, Rachel refuses to turn her gaze away. RACHEL’S POV: The upstairs window of the Blue House. In i Rachel sees herself! Standing in the window in the light day.

I used to live two doors down... number 13 Beckett Road. It was my first home. We bought it together. It was ours. RACHEL’S MEMORY: Rachel, in the Blue House, turns from t window to come face to face with a handsome man, TOM. The smile and laugh as Rachel grabs him. He kisses her passionately as they enjoy their empty, NEWLY-PURCHASED H BACK ON THE TRAIN: Rachel blinks: she is still looking at blue house.
Every day, I tell myself not to look. RACHEL’S POV: NOW, in reality, a woman, ANNA, stands in t window holding a BABY, EVIE.
But then I look... Rachel watches as Anna becomes a tiny dot that vanishes i the distance.
Are you alone? Rachel looks up to see a Woman holding a one-year-old lit boy. And now the moment of truth for Rachel:
(polite) Yeah. She pats the seat next to her and takes her bag from it.
No, come. It’s all yours. Rachel smiles at the child.
Your baby’s so cute. (to boy) Hi, baby.
Thank you.
Is it... Is it a boy?
Yeah. (CONTINUED)
So sweet. How...how old is he?
Six months.
Six months. Rachel softly squeezes the boy’s hand and giggles. The Wo begins to pick up on Rachel’s slurred speech and notices little empty vodka bottles at the mouth of Rachel’s purse

So sweet. Rachel realizes the Woman knows she is drunk. The Woman repositions her child away from Rachel. CLOSE ON: Rachel’s eyes, bleary, blink in slow motion. Rachel, now seated alone, drinks from her squirt bottle.
Title: MEGAN

A Living Portrait: MEGAN, the woman Rachel watches from t train-- up close and drop-dead gorgeous. OVERHEAD SHOT: Megan lies face up on a Pilates machine. She grips the hand straps, and with precision and grace, begins a series of exercises, stretching her body like a ballerina’s.

(pre-lap) A teacher once told me I was a mistress of self-reinvention... We widen to see she is lined up with ten other suburban women. With both admiration and defeat, a FRUSTRATED WOMA observes Megan’s flexibility and strength.
(pre-lap) ...-I wasn’t really sure what it meant at the time. But since moving here I’ve come to understand it...
(CONTINUED)
Title: 6 MONTHS AGO

On the sidewalk, the women from class have congregated, a chatting happily, occasionally cutting looks towards Mega who takes no notice as she starts to jog away. We see her running down our quaint Ardsley Village street.
(pre-lap) Ardsley-on-Hudson is boring and routine. It’s a fucking baby factory.
Megan jogs into a long dark underpass linking the outside world to Beckett.
(pre-lap) I want to start my life over again. So far, I’ve been: rebellious teenager, lover, waitress...
Megan continues down Beckett Road and jogs up her drivewa INT. MEGAN’S HOUSE - LATER THAT MORNING Megan stands in front of an open closet. Her ivory hand d between silk blouses and skirts.

.--gallery director, nanny, and... a whore... (a moment) And not necessarily in that order. Scott approaches, slides his hands down Megan’s side, the her skirt to remove her panties. They begin to have sex against the open closet.
(pre-lap) I can’t just be a wife anymore. She is disconnected, disinterested. Scott doesn’t notice.
(pre-lap) That's why I stay awake at night, staring at the ceiling.  INT. DR. ABDIC’S OFFICE - DAY CLOSE ON: MEGAN’S FACE AS SHE TALKS TO SOMEONE:
...In fact, the only time I feel like myself is when I’m running.
You always felt that way?
Maybe since I was about seventeen. With Mac.
Mac? Who’s Mac?

My brother’s best friend. My brother who died... We finally see the extremely handsome, dark-haired man wh sits across from Megan. This is DR. KAMAL ABDIC. He’s for with a quiet command. She has been speaking to him the wh time. She smiles. She covers her mouth with her hand.
I tend to smile when I’m nervous. Sometimes, I laugh. She moves from her chair to a couch across the room. A moment passes. Finally, the Doctor’s inviting silence elicits Megan’s confession:

For a year, Mac and I lived in this hunting cabin. We started fucking. We were the saddest people we knew. But in a way, that cabin made us happy. No one could find us. (a moment) Everyone thought we were dead.
And if you were to run away today, right now, where would you go? Megan glances outside, where she can see the train passin The Doctor notices. Megan moves again, to sit much closer him. (CONTINUED)
I read once that when a train hits, it can rip the clothes right off of you. After a moment:
I’m pretty sure Scott thinks the nanny job is gonna make me less restless-- make me wanna get pregnant...
And that’s not the case?

When I finish work every night, I run home, and I get in the shower and wash the smell of that baby off me as fast as I can. Megan stares at Abdic. He waits for her to continue, but just looks at him with great intensity. PRE-LAP: A gentle lullaby, and the sound of splashing wat A baby's giggle.
Title: ANNA
Title: TODAY INT. TOM AND ANNA’S HOUSE - BATHROOM - DUSK A living portrait: ANNA, pure and sweet, with dimples for days, looks down into the camera with absolute love.
...When you woke up this morning I went and I brought you back to bed with me... Anna kneels on the tiled floor, leaning over the bathtub, gently washing her baby, EVIE.

...-And when I was feeding you. We heard daddy singing from the kitchen, didn’t we? (sung to her baby) “Happy Birthday to you, Happy Birthday to you, Happy Birthday dear Anna, Happy Birthday to you!” (CONTINUED)
Megan, her nanny, steps out of the dark shadow, holding a towel for Anna to place her baby into.
Daddy came upstairs with a beautiful breakfast that he made for Mommy, didn’t he? Yes he did. (noticing Megan) Thank you, Megan. Anna places her baby into Megan’s arms.
There you go. INT. TOM AND ANNA’S BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER Megan hands the swaddled baby to Anna who now lays in her bed. Anna sits Evie on her stomach.
(to Evie) Oh, hello. Anna laughs as she tickles Evie and turns to Megan.
I swear I sometimes feel like my heart is gonna explode. I mean, look at her. (laughing) Look at her! The phone rings. Megan goes to answer it.
(to Evie, playful) You're not sleeping! You’re not sleeping...
(on phone) Hello? Hello? Anita’s interest is piqued. She takes Evie into the--
She finds Megan on the hallway phone.
Hello...? Megan pushes the END button on the phone. Anna steps into hall. (CONTINUED)
Is that another hang-up?
...Mm-hmm. Anna, visibly shaken, tries not to get upset.
Anna has Megan help her fold a fitted sheet.
.»..and grab the corners. And straighten.
I got another job. Anna is blindsided.
+..You what?
I’m really sorry, Anna.
(confused) I thought you were happy here. I mean, you seemed happy here...
I am. It’s just this isn’t what I “do.”
...Take care of children...? Megan drops the folded sheet onto a pile.
Or laundry. (beat) Another gallery head-hunted me.
(trying to be positive) ...That's great.
The thing is, it starts tomorrow. (CONTINUED)
I’m out all day tomorrow. That is so uncool.
I hate to leave you like this, without childcare, but...you don’t have a job. Anna turns away, insulted.
Ok, that sounded wrong. I know that you're busy volunteering...

It’s not the volunteering. It’s all the shopping, it’s spending hours in the farmer's market, it’s finding the right foods for her, it’s pureeing sweet potatoes. And I do all of this at the same time as I’m nursing. Megan looks at Anna carefully. Anna is exhausted.
Maybe you should go back to work, too. Mothers need to work, it’s actually better for the kid...
How would you know? That was a low blow. Megan absorbs it, hurt, then gently her set of keys down on the counter.
Your key.
There is no job more important than raising a child... Megan heads out of the kitchen towards the front door.
(defeated) Megan, please... Megan exits without turning.  13.

Anna stirs from a nap on the couch to the sound of Evie crying...coming from outside. She races to the open front door in a panic. EXT. TOM AND ANNA’S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER Anna emerges from the house, frightened, and rushes forwa
Rachel? What are you doing? Give me my baby. We see Rachel standing in the middle of the yard, cradlin Evie.
Rachel, what are you doing?! INT. TOM AND ANNA’S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER Close on Anna, reliving what we realize was a memory.
Hello? Tom enters. We recognize him as the Man from Rachel’s mem on the train. He hands Anna some flowers and groceries and kisses her sweetly on the lips.
(re: flowers) Thank you... Beautiful. She notices that he’s on his phone.
How many times has she texted you today?
(frustrated) I don’t know.
(unable to relax) She called the landline three times.
Wow. (CONTINUED)
You have to have a talk with her.
I know.
It’s getting crazy.
I will. I know I know I know.
Okay. Tom cups Anna’s face gently in his hands.
It’s going to be fine. Isn’t it always fine? Don’t I always make everything fine?... Anna won't smile. He playfully pokes at her lips until sh laughs. They kiss.
Who gives a shit? It’s your birthday. You sure you don’t want me to take you out tonight?
No, I like it at home. He opens a beer and sets the magnetic corkscrew/bottle op on the fridge door before hopping onto the counter.
Call Megan. Ask her to come back.
She just quit.
She what?
.--She just told me she got another job.
...Shame. I thought you guys were kind of a good team together...
So did I.  15.

RACHEL’S APARTMENT - SAME NIGHT CLOSE ON: A cellphone sits on the counter, dialing on speaker. Rachel pours a glass of white wine. VERY DRUNK. Tom’s voicemail picks up:
(outgoing message) Hey, it’s Tom. Sorry I missed you. I'll get right back to ya!
(into phone) Hey, Tom, it's me. I just wanted to wish Momma a happy birthday. "Happy birthday, Momma--” CATHY, Rachel’s roommate, appears, grabs Rachel’s phone a presses END.
Rachel! Jesus... Cathy pours the wine down the sink. Rachel grabs at the bottle.
No no no. No, don’t, Cathy. Please stop it! Cathy, come on! But Cathy easily fends her off.
Relax, relax. Unsteady, Rachel nods and softens.
I just need something to go to sleep. I just need a little bit to go to sleep. Cathy gently guides Rachel towards her room.
What brought this on? (CONTINUED)
He posted another picture of the baby. It was a cute picture.
Yeah? Facebook and drunk ex-wives do not make good friends. Offended by the implication, Rachel pulls away from Cathy
I got it. I got it.
Alright. I’1l just get you to your room. They've arrived at Rachel’s room. INT. RACHEL’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Rachel crawls into the bed looking around her small room.
Rachel, you have to stop calling them. Okay? Rachel nods. She reaches up to pull Cathy to sit beside h
I really appreciate this room. I do. I thought that I would just be here for a couple of weeks or a month.
(abrupt) Yeah. That was two years ago. But she shakes her head and smiles.

Get some sleep. Cathy switches off the light and leaves. Rachel looks at phone. INSERT: Rachel’s outgoing call log screen reads: TOM (11) Rachel looks over the times: 11:02, 11:12, 11:54, 12:09. lets out a sigh. INT. DOCTOR’S OFFICE - DAY - RACHEL’S MEMORY Rachel and Tom sit in a DOCTOR’s office, distraught. (CONTINUED)
IVF rarely works the first time. Would you like a moment? Tom takes Rachel’s hand.
It's okay, sweetie. We’re gonna try again.
We can’t afford to do it again.

Well, when we can, we will. She rests her head on his shoulder. He kisses it. INT. RACHEL’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Rachel stirs in her bad and a new memory intrudes. EXT. SCOTT AND MEGAN’S HOUSE - NIGHT Rachel remembers Scott and Megan snuggling outside by the fire pit, kissing. INT. RACHEL’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Rachel finally sleeps.
The train surges by along the tracks.

Rachel rides the train as it barrels past homes and buildings. Rachel reaches into her purse and pulls out a tube of lipstick. She brings it to her lips, but quickly realizes that she can’t steady her hands enough to put it on. So, almost by rote, she puts it away. Rachel catches eyes with the MAN IN THE SUIT. The Man sha his head in judgement and raises a magazine to his face.
From high above, the train crawls along the riverside.  19.
RACHEL’S POV OUT THE WINDOW: Rachel sees Megan alone on h porch, looking out at the train...

I wonder what she’s looking at... Or if she even sees this train at all. ..-Rachel gives a little smile. A moment of reprieve from troubled mind... NOW, SOMETHING PECULIAR HAPPENS... ...a DARK-HAIRED MAN steps onto the porch, and embraces Megan. CLOSE ON: Rachel blinks. The train stops at the station, allowing Rachel a closer look. The Dark-Haired Man’s face is obscured in the shadows, BU IS NOT SCOTT...
Who is that man? AND THEN THEY KISS. The train begins moving again and Rachel quickly jumps to feet...

The next station is: Ardsley-on- Hudson. ...-Rachel pushes her way up the aisle, blocked by a few people who have just boarded the train. With every few steps Rachel takes, she manages to see ano sliver of the view of Megan and the Dark-Haired Man. Rachel enters the next car, running to keep her view as t train departs. BOOM! Another train barrels by in the opposite direction, totally obscuring Rachel’s view. A familiar ache fills Rachel’s chest. She bends over, fee sick.
What is she doing?  20.

Rachel exits her train with scores of other commuters, looking numb. She’s bombarded by images, fast cuts of: - Megan and the man kissing. We recognizes him as Dr. Abd - Glimpses of a laptop, displaying an email with the subj
Devastated, Rachel walks toward the Grand Hall. She passe the window of a liquor store. She slows.

She flashes to Megan and Abdic kissing... then to her res her head on Tom’s shoulder at the clinic. And then to the email. We get a cleaner view. It’s a chai between Tom and Anna. INT. TOM AND ANNA’S HOUSE - DAY RACHEL’S MEMORY: Rachel sits in front of an open laptop staring at the email as Tom’s voice reads it.
Anna, I fell asleep last night thinking of you. I dreamed about kissing the inside of your thighs. Holding your breasts. God, I wish I was fucking you right now. (CONTINUED)
Rachel slams the laptop closed and hurls it against the bedroom wall.
Anna walks alone, overcome by tears, trying to banish the memories.
Anna, I love you. I love you so much.
(pre-lap) When it happened to me, I found dozens of emails. Tom told her that he’d never felt like this before. He said it wouldn’t be that much longer until they were together.
Rachel sits at the lunch counter drinking a martini. She speaks to another patron. A WOMAN, 70, who is drinking al as well.

I know what they say: “You shouldn’t check his email.” I was stupid. But when I saw it was from the realtor I thought that it was just spam. And then I realized that they were kisses not Xs and my husband was fucking a Century 21 Agent. She laughs at the absurdity.
That sucks.
It does. Her name was Anna Boyd and he was in love with her.
CLOSE-ON: Rachel runs lipstick over a mirror, creating a xX XXX xX. She turns from the mirror where the woman is standing and watching her. Rachel raises her phone in front of them. (CONTINUED)
(drunk whisper to woman) Come here for one second. Say "fuck you, Anna Boyd", but just yell it. The woman nods. Rachel turns on the phone's video. Togeth they shout into the camera.
Fuck you, Anna Boyd! Rachel sets the phone down on the edge of the sink. The p still recording video as she continues her rant.

That bitch is living in my house. I picked everything in that house. I picked everything. I picked the dining table, the kitchen table. I wonder if she knows that I fucked Tom on the same table that her baby eats at. I just want to tell her. I wish I could tell her. I picked everything in that house. I fucking picked everything in that house! Rachel turns back to the mirror. Her energy has shifted, there's an anger rising within her.

...I could never find the words to describe how I felt when I read that e-mail, but this morning, I did. I did. When I saw that woman kissing someone else, betraying her husband, I felt it. I felt... Pure. Rage. Slowly the Camera pushes into Rachel’s naked face as the sound of the bar vanish.

...-Like something has been taken from ME again. If I could... If I could, I’d just go to her house. And I'd go in and find her sitting at the kitchen table. I’d wrap my hand in her long blonde hair and jerk her head back. Just jerk it back! And then I’d pull her down to the ground and I would just smash her head all over the floor! Rachel smears the lipstick Xs into oblivion in her rage. (CONTINUED)
Hold. Rachel stands alone in the middle of the bathroom, nobody listening, in total SILENCE.

Rachel, her eyes alive with a drunken mission, stands on packed train, her body sways with the train’s rhythms. Sh sucks down vodka from her squirt bottle. SIXTY SCHOOL CHILDREN DRESSED IN UNIFORM fill the car. Rambunctious and loud, their noise consumes the train. One YOUNG GIRL catches Rachel’s eye, regarding her frankl Rachel looks around and it seems like everyone is staring her. Rachel's gaze careens out the window trying to see into Megan’s house. The image of Megan kissing Abdic flashes in her vision ov and over. The train slows to a stop. Rachel suddenly pushes her way through the crowd to get off the train, pushing through t kids and other commuters who block her way.
Move! Get out of my way! Move! Rachel runs down the aisle and gets off the train.

Rachel’s feet HIT the platform and she stumbles forward, oblivious to conversations going on around her. She quick picks herself up and runs down the side of the train as t engine screams past her. Rachel leaves the station and looks ahead through the ARC THE UNDERPASS-- the dark tunnel. She is driven onward by Man, who seems to be following her. She drunkenly cuts off the road into the woods, but conti towards the underpass. Something inexplicable pulls her forward. (CONTINUED)
In a mad trance, Rachel hears the click-click-click of hi heels, and sees a BLONDE WOMAN striding purposefully into underpass. Is it Anna?
Hey! Hey!!! She chases the woman into the dark underpass, sees the woman’s red jacket moving further away, and bellows out:

Rachel’s hand, with dirt under the fingernails. Her sweater, matted with bloo the shoulder. Her phone, also flecked with blood. Rachel stirs painfully and we see her hair matted with bl as well. The train disappears into a tunnel under the city streets INT. CHURCH OF ST. LUKE’S, NYC - MONDAY MORNING A group of about fifty people meet. Rachel is among them. DAVID is the facilitator. (CONTINUED)
Anyone counting days one to ninety who would like to share a day count?

Hey, Jason. / Welcome, Jason.
I’ve got twenty-two days back. The group applauds warmly.

This is day one, I suppose. I’m here because I... (there’s no easy way to put this) Because I woke up this morning covered in blood. And I had bruises all over my arm and... It’s usually from when I’ve fallen and someone has helped me up. My husband... He used to tell me what I’d done the night before... And I learned that when you wake up like that, you just say you're sorry. You just say you're sorry for what you did and you're sorry for who you are and you're never gonna do it again. But you do. You do it again. Rachel swallows back tears.
And there's... time missing. I need to remember. I need to remember. Rachel sits back down. On her face as David moves on. 27. (CONTINUED)

text: INTO TOM’S NECK. Tom dies. Anna stands. The two women face each other in silence. EXT. TOM AND ANNA’S HOUSE - LATER Detectives Riley and Gaskill escort Anna and Rachel to a waiting squad car. Rachel looks up to see Scott standing in the lawn next do Scott stares at Rachel stopping her in her tracks. She and Scott share a knowing look. Without words, much i said and forgiven.

Riley and two Police Officers lead Rachel and Anna into t station. As they are led into different rooms, Rachel and Anna sha one final glance. They are now tied together, forever bound, by the stories they tell.
Riley and Gaskill videotape Rachel’s statement.
I had no choice. He was... He would have killed me. I never wanted to hurt him. It was self-defense. Pushing in on Riley, we turn to see Anna is now at the ta giving her statement.
She had no choice. Tom would have killed her. I saw the whole thing. Rachel was right about Megan. She was right about everything.  95.
Rachel, looking more put together than we’ve seen, makes way towards a low headstone: “MEGAN HIPWELL 1990-2016” She silently pays her respects.
We are tied forever now, the three of us.
Rachel sits, sketching before the Dancing Maids Fountain. fountain isn’t flowing.
Bound forever by the story we share. CLOSE SHOTS ON: The Three Maid’s faces and dancing bodies preserved as a relic of the past.
Trees blur as the train rolls by.
Rachel sits looking out the window of the train. She sees houses on Beckett Road drift by as the train passes, then turns to look out the other window.
Today, I sit in a different car. And I look ahead. Anything is possible. Because I am not the girl I used to be.
The train continues onward, curving along the river to disappear beyond the trees. FADE OUT.
